intro: Hicorius laciniosa, commonly known as the lace fern, is a striking tropical plant characterized by its delicate, feathery fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to regions of Southeast Asia. The plant features intricate, lacy patterns on its leaves, which give it its common name. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining, moist soil. Hicorius laciniosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in both indoor and outdoor settings.
